Welcome to contacts’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: Session, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database. :param body: ContactSchema: Validate the data that is passed in :param db: Session: Pass in the database session :param user: User: Get the user id from the token :return: The contact object that was just created

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶
Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to delete the contact

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts(body: ContactSearchSchema, db: Session, user: User)¶

The find_contacts function is used to search for contacts in the database. It takes a ContactSearchSchema as input, which contains all of the fields that can be searched on. The function then creates a list of conditions based on what values are present in the schema, and uses those conditions to filter out results from the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSearchSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session, user: User)¶
Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the results by user

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

Fetches a specific contact for a user. :param contact_id: :param db: :param user: :return:

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function fetches a list of contacts for a specific user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Specify the number of contacts to return

  • offset – int: Specify the number of contacts to skip

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database. :param body: ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the body of the request :param contact_id: int: Identify the contact to be updated :param db: Session: Pass the database session to the function :param user: User: Ensure that the user is authorized to update the contact :return: The updated contact object

REST API service Email¶

REST API service Users¶

async src.services.users.reset_password_item(request: Request, email: str)¶

Renders a password reset page for a given user.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • email (str) – The email of the user who wants to reset their password.

Returns:

The rendered password reset page.

Return type:

TemplateResponse
